greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if sigma(p^e) is prime, and 1 otherwise.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if (p^(1+e) - 1)/(p-1) = 1 + p + p^2 + ... + p^e is prime, and 1 otherwise.
example: For n = 150 = 2 * 3 * 5^2, sigma(2) = 3 is a prime, sigma(3) = 4 is not prime, and sigma(25) = 31 is a prime, thus a(150) = 2 * 25 = 50.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 29 2019
